instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 Rails Pulsing
threads.message: Got this board here which had no power. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> was low, only 0.45V. I found corrosion under <CHIP>U8020</CHIP>, so I replaced it and got back <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> to normal. Now the board pulses all S0 rails in loop but does not turn on. I inspected whole board and could not find any more corrosion in it. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 Rails Pulsing
threads.message:
Tried in SMC bypass?

Should be good to reball SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 Rails Pulsing
threads.message: In SMC bypass, it does a quarter fan spin and dies. Will try reballing it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 Rails Pulsing
threads.message: Rebelling the SMC did nothing different to this board. Same thing, still pulsing S0

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 Rails Pulsing
threads.message:
CPU core coils pulsing too?
What about <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 Rails Pulsing
threads.message: CPU VCORE pulses too and also <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 Rails Pulsing
threads.message:
POssibly accumulated crap under PCH.
Heat it with quality flux.
